events.originalText: War in Somalia: Somali National Army forces and their AMISOM and Raskamboni allies launched an offensive against Al-Shabaab in the latter's last major stronghold of Kismayo.
events.subtitle: Somali civil war (2009–present)
events.headline: Somali National Army launches offensive against Al-Shabaab in Kismayo

events.originalText: A protest held by 50,000 people in Conakry, Guinea, was forcefully disrupted by the military junta, resulting in at least 157 deaths and over 1,200 injuries.
events.subtitle: 2009 Guinean protests
events.headline: Military junta disrupts protest in Conakry, Guinea, resulting in 157 deaths

events.originalText: Typhoon Xangsane passed Manila on its way to causing more than 300 deaths, mostly in the Phillippines and Vietnam.
events.subtitle: Typhoon Xangsane
events.headline: Typhoon Xangsane causes over 300 deaths in Philippines and Vietnam

events.originalText: Pope John Paul I died only 33 days after his papal election due to an apparent myocardial infarction, resulting in the first year of three popes since 1605.
events.subtitle: Pope John Paul I
events.headline: Pope John Paul I dies 33 days after election

events.originalText: An attempted robbery of Spaghetti House, a restaurant in Knightsbridge, London, turned into a six-day hostage situation.
events.subtitle: Knightsbridge
events.headline: Robbery at Spaghetti House in London turns into six-day hostage situation

events.originalText: Against the backdrop of the Cold War, the Canadian ice hockey team defeated the Soviet team in the Summit Series.
events.subtitle: Cold War
events.headline: Canadian ice hockey team defeats Soviet team in Summit Series

events.originalText: Whaam!, now considered one of Roy Lichtenstein's most important works, debuted at an exhibition held at the Leo Castelli Gallery, New York City.
events.subtitle: Whaam!
events.headline: Roy Lichtenstein's Whaam! debuts at Leo Castelli Gallery in New York City

events.originalText: Scottish biologist and pharmacologist Alexander Fleming (pictured) discovered penicillin when he noticed a bacteria-killing mould growing in his laboratory.
events.subtitle: Alexander Fleming
events.headline: Alexander Fleming discovers penicillin in laboratory

events.originalText: A team of U.S. Army Air Service aviators landed in Seattle, Washington, to complete the first aerial circumnavigation of the world.
events.subtitle: United States Army Air Service
events.headline: U.S. Army Air Service aviators complete first aerial circumnavigation of the world

events.originalText: Philippine–American War: Filipino guerrillas killed more than forty American soldiers in a surprise attack on the town of Balangiga on the island of Samar.
events.subtitle: Philippine–American War
events.headline: Filipino guerrillas kill over forty American soldiers in Balangiga attack

events.originalText: The Declaration of Independence of the Mexican Empire from Spain was drafted in the National Palace in Mexico City.
events.subtitle: Declaration of Independence (Mexico)
events.headline: Mexican Empire declares independence from Spain in Mexico City

events.originalText: Explorer Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo (pictured), the first European to travel along the coast of California, landed at what is now the city of San Diego.
events.subtitle: Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo
events.headline: Explorer Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo lands in San Diego, California

events.originalText: In the Battle of Tinchebray in Normandy, the invading King Henry I of England captured his brother Robert Curthose.
events.subtitle: Battle of Tinchebray
events.headline: King Henry I captures brother Robert Curthose in Battle of Tinchebray

events.originalText: William the Conqueror and his fleet of around 600 ships landed at Pevensey, Sussex, beginning the Norman conquest of England.
events.subtitle: William the Conqueror
events.headline: William the Conqueror lands in Pevensey, Sussex, beginning Norman conquest of England

events.originalText: The Eastern Roman armies under Constantius II defeated those of the usurper Magnentius at the Battle of Mursa Major.
events.subtitle: Constantius II
events.headline: Eastern Roman armies defeat Magnentius at Battle of Mursa Major

events.originalText: Pope Pontian resigned after being exiled to Sardinia, becoming the first pope to relinquish the position; he was reportedly beaten to death with sticks weeks later.
events.subtitle: Pope Pontian
events.headline: Pope Pontian resigns and is reportedly beaten to death with sticks
